course.subject: ENTR
course.name: Entrepreneurship Mentorship and Readings
course.description: This course introduces entrepreneurship through mentorship and readings to broadly expose students to the area. Students can choose their own area of interest to study, and they can also explore and further develop their interested area with their mentor. While there will be group meetings every two weeks, students are required to explore and participate in entrepreneurship activities on their own. The instructor will help students consolidate their experiences. Instructor's approval is required for course enrollment. Graded P or F.

reviews.author: hyp
reviews.comment_content:
Overall a very relaxing course. Class meeting once per month, the rest of the time is attending seminars and writing reports.

Need to self register entrepreneur seminar, but TA will provide a list of seminar that are suitable for the course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
No teaching. Only meeting and discussion with prof, TA and classmates.

Prof Huang is really really friendly and chatty, very willing to offer help. Since the class only have 10 people, we have a whatsapp group to share information about entrepreneur activities and talk some random stuff that is not related to the course
reviews.comment_grading:
No final nor mid term, but need to take attendance - 10%

There are 3 meeting reports; 1 individual meeting report with prof, 2 group meeting reports - 30%

4 activity reports (200 words) - 20%

2 book report (1000 words) - 20%

1 self development paper (1000 words) - 20%
reviews.comment_workload: Moderate. But need to write many reports. However, no need to write many words so it is relaxing. I can complete one activity report within 30 mins.

reviews.author: mokmok
reviews.comment_content:
- Self-exploration
- Only attend 10-11 weeks
- Mostly attending class for Individual project presentation, blog post sharing, debate
- Meet with entrepreneurs
- Help you to find your interest and ideas for your future start-up
- Feel free to share your thought in the class
- Finish reading 2 selected books and one book chosen from you to complete the book reports
reviews.comment_teaching:
Sharing and discussion with 13 people (prof, TA and classmates).

Prof Huang
- friendly and chatty
- willing to help students (when we stuggle with the topic of project and career path)
- Open a WhatsApp group to share your thoughts not relate to class
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance                                      10%
Debate                                             15% (5% each)
Book Reports                                   15% (5% each)
Group Meeting Reflections              15% (5% each)
Entrepreneurship Blog Post             10%
Curiosity Project (Individual)             25%
Personal Development Paper/Video 10%
reviews.comment_workload:
Many small tasks and active participation
3 In-class debate
3 Book reports (around 300 words each)
3 Group meeting reflections (article, 80 words each)
1 Entrepreneurship blog post (interview with entrepreneur and 5 mins sharing in the class, around 300 words)
1 Personal development paper (around 1000 words)
1 Curiosity project (not less than 3 mins presentation with ppt)
